meanings.definition: Directed toward the back or past
meanings.sent1: She took a backward glance at the old photo album.
meanings.sent2: He walked backward to retrace his steps.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to walk backward but ended up looking confused.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a backward clock, always dwelling on memories.
meanings.sent5: The backward motion of the swing made her feel nostalgic.

meanings.definition: Opposite to the usual direction of movement
meanings.sent1: The car moved backward slowly in the parking lot.
meanings.sent2: He felt a backward pull as the train started moving in reverse.
meanings.sent3: The backward race was a fun twist on the traditional competition.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to flow backward under the force of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The backward wind blew the leaves in an unusual pattern.

meanings.sent1: The student was backward in completing the assignment.
meanings.sent2: The town's technology was backward compared to the neighboring city.
meanings.sent3: His backward approach to problem-solving often led to unique solutions.
meanings.sent4: The company's outdated methods held them backward in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The backward growth of the plant puzzled the botanist.
